summary: canine distemper virus (CDV) is a major pathogen of dogs and wild carnivores worldwide. in recent years, the import of dogs from eastern Europe to Switzerland has steadily increased. the data on vaccination and medical history were recorded (14 dogs) long-term follow-up using sensitive PCR and strict quarantine measures is of upmost importance in preventing the spread of infection. dog owners and animal welfare organisations should be educated about the importance of complete vaccinations.
